definition: middle (of a period of time)/medium-term (plan, forecast etc)
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: In technical side, short and mid-term technical indicators keep on rise.
sentences.chinese: 技术面，短期及中期各项技术指标保持多头强势状态。

sentences.english: We expect yield curves to steepen significantly over the medium term.
sentences.chinese: 我们预计收益率曲线将在中期显著变陡。

sentences.english: It was the mid-1970's and I was your age.
sentences.chinese: 当时是70年代中期，我正是你们现在这个年龄。

sentences.english: The story begins in the middle of the fierce fighting of the second world war.
sentences.chinese: 故事开始于二战中期的激烈战斗。

sentences.english: They are about the same as the USA in the mid-60's.
sentences.chinese: 他们就跟美国在60年代中期时一样。

sentences.english: But the mid-term election made his position untenable.
sentences.chinese: 然而中期选举的局势让他高位难守。

sentences.english: The phrase "honey mo one" appeared in the mid-16th century.
Malaysia is expected to be held in mid-mid-2012 national elections.
sentences.chinese: 预计马来西亚将在2012年年中期前举行全国大选。

sentences.english: In addition, our intermediate-term indicators are currently moderately bearish.
sentences.chinese: 另外，我们的中期指标正在适度地悲观。

sentences.english: The nuclear phase of the mature egg is of metaphase of the first mature division.
sentences.chinese: 卵子的成熟核相为第一次成熟分裂中期。

sentences.english: For this reason, we continue to remain bearish on Indian equities over the intermediate-term trend.
sentences.chinese: 出于这个原因，中期内我们继续看跌印度股票。

sentences.english: The campaign began in mid-March and is set to last until late December this year.
sentences.chinese: 这项运动开始在三月中期，一直持续到今年十月末。

sentences.english: Yet in mid-1982 she went on air.
sentences.chinese: 可她在1982年中期还是开始了这个节目的广播。

sentences.english: Middle degree of water stree was the limit of non-damage apricot leaves.
sentences.chinese: 中度胁迫中期是叶片不受失水伤害的极限。

sentences.english: The second American feminist movement began in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 第二次美国妇女运动始于二十世纪六十年代中期。

definition: specific to a particular stage (of a project etc)/interim (policy etc)/occurring in stages/phased
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
